info.title: Medius Web API
info.description: Beneath are the full list of available API:s in your environment. Please use the tools below to try it out! Remember to activate the SwaggerUI client application in Medius([click here](../../#Administration/Medius.Core.Entities.Api.ClientApplication))

externalDocs.description: Find out more information in the success portal

tags.name: Master data - import
tags.description: Master data import used by the suite

tags.name: AP Automation: Invoice import
tags.description: Import of supplier invoices from external source.

tags.name: Procurement: Purchase orders and receipts
tags.description: Purchase order and goods receipt ERP synchronization

tags.name: Pay
tags.description: Import of payment batches and reconciliation

post.description:
The POST method allows the client to send accrual templates that will be imported by the Medius master data import queue.
The accrual template have the company and the dimension values used in the template as prerequisites.
Remember that by sending in accrual templates the integration will updated them all the time, so manual changes of the properties included
in this data is not possible to set within Medius.

requestBody.description: The accrual templates to import

201.description: Response includes Location header with a link to the import batch, this link will give the status of how the batch is processing within Medius

get.description:
The GET method will allow you to check status for an imported batch. When performing a POST, the link returned is pointing to this method.
This method allows the client to orchestrate so that the client can wait until dependent master data is imported correctly before sending that data.

parameters.name: importId
parameters.description: The import id is either retrieved by the full link from the result of the POST or from within the Medius master data import queue

delete.description:
The DELETE method allows a client to remove an import item from the queue, this to allow an integration to take full responsibility
of resending master data batches and handle all error on the client side instead of within Medius. it's only possible to remove items that are not in a running state.

parameters.name: importId
parameters.description: The import id is either retrieved by the full link from the result of the POST or from within the Medius master data import queue

post.description:
The POST method allows the client to send approval groups that will be imported by the Medius master data import queue.
The approval groups have company and currency prerequisite.

 For detailed information on approval group set-up, see [Success portal](https://success.medius.com/documentation/administration_guide/administration_pages/approval_group/)

requestBody.description: The approval group to import

201.description: Response includes Location header with a link to the import batch, this link will give the status of how the batch is processing within Medius.

get.description:
When calling this endpoint a list of companies will be returned. The list includes both "real" and "virtual" companies.
There exists one filter parameter to this request, that is updatedSince, it filters out companies that have been changed since
the updatedSince time stamp.
It's possible adjust page sizes and offsets.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records returned(max 1000)

parameters.name: updatedSince
parameters.description: Tells the service that we only want companies that have been changed after this date and time

post.description:
The POST method allows the client to send a set of companies that will be imported by the Medius master data import queue.
The company have Currency as prerequisite
The company will be created as a child company to either the root company or to another company provided

requestBody.description: The companies to import

post.description:
The POST method allows the client to send a set of delivery lines that will be imported by the Medius master data import queue.
The purchase order line header must exist in Medius before a delivery line can be imported. Use of key PurchaseOrderLineExternalSystemId is mandatory to be able to find corresponding purchase order line.

requestBody.description: The delivery line to import.

get.description:
This method returns a list of file links for a document identified by parameter 'documentId'.
Each file link consists of the original file name and a link for downloading this file.
Draft, migrated and long-term archived documents are not supported by this API.

parameters.name: documentId
parameters.description: Document ID

get.description:
This method returns a file with the given hash for a document identified by parameter 'documentId'.
You can get a link for this file, containing hash, by calling 'integration/media/v1/document/{documentId}/images'.
Draft, migrated and long-term archived documents are not supported by this API.

parameters.name: documentId
parameters.description: Document ID

parameters.name: imageHash
parameters.description: Hash of image

get.description:
This method returns the list of attachment links for a document identified by parameter 'documentId'.
Each attachment link consists of the original attachment name, and a link for downloading this attachment.
Draft, migrated and long-term archived documents are not supported by this API.

parameters.name: documentId
parameters.description: Document ID

get.description:
This method returns the attachment with a given hash for the document identified by parameter 'documentId'.
You can get the link for this attachment, containing hash, by calling 'integration/media/v1/document/{documentId}/attachments'.
Draft, migrated and long-term archived documents are not supported by this API.

parameters.name: documentId
parameters.description: Document ID

parameters.name: attachmentHash
parameters.description: Hash of attachment

get.description:
This method returns the error messages content from a message that matches the status and the id.
If the message id is in another status, nothing will be returned. To find a message, use the other GET method that only provides message id as input.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The id of the message

parameters.name: messageStatus
parameters.description: The message status, can be Posted, Fetched, Processing, Sent, Closed or Error

get.description:
This method will return a status and an effective link to the real error messages content.
The main idea with this method is to be able to check status for a give message and to be able to find where a message is in terms of statuses.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The message id of the message to find/check status

post.description:
This method accepts a error message object including a list of error messages.
The error message object requires a CorrelationKey that needs to match the corresponding supplier invoice message.

The POST method allows the client to send periods that will be imported by the Medius master data import queue.
The periods have Company as prerequisites.
Remember that by sending in periods the integration will updated them all the time, so manual changes of the properties included
in this data is not possible to set within Medius. For periods it might be better to keep them in Medius to be able to control the
posting dates separated from the ERP system, for flexibility reasons.

post.description:
The POST method allows the client to send a set of purchase orders that will be imported by the Medius master data import queue.
The purchase order need to be imported after the mandatory pre requisites are imported, these are Company and Supplier.
If specific units and items are used, these needs to be in place also.

requestBody.description: The purchase orders to import

201.description: Response includes Location header with a link to the import batch, this link will give the status of how the batch is processing within Medius

get.description:
When calling this endpoint a list of purchase orders will be returned.
There exists one filter parameter to this request, that is updatedSince, it filters out purchase orders that have been changed since
the updatedSince time stamp.
It's possible adjust page sizes and offsets.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records returned(max 1000)

parameters.name: includeLines
parameters.description: Include purchase order lines with delivery lines and items data in the response or not

parameters.name: updatedSince
parameters.description: Tells the service that we only want purchase orders with or without lines that have been changed after this date and time

get.description:
The GET method returns the purchase order content from a message that matches the provided status and id.
If the message id is in another status, nothing is returned. To find a message, use the other GET method that only requires message id as input.

parameters.name: messageStatus
parameters.description: Message status. Can be: Posted, Fetched, Processing, Sent, Closed or Error

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The message id of the message to find

put.description: This method updates the status of a purchase order message when processing it.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Message id to change the status for

parameters.name: messageStatus
parameters.description: Status that the message is in before the status change

requestBody.description: The status to set. Possible statuses are: Fetched, Processing or Sent

get.description:
The GET method with message id as input returns a status and an effective link to real purchase order content.
This method allows you to check the status of a given message.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Message id

get.description:
This method returns all messages that match the specified parameters.
The mandatory parameter is the status. All other parameters are sent as querystring parameters to narrow down the result.
The query string parameters are used, for example, to only return messages of certain type
The correlation key filter is used to filter out messages by the it's value, typically used to filter on invoice type or company.
The correlation key filter is built on a set of properties on the invoice with a delimiter: ';'.
(Be sure to check the number of ';' you have in your correlation key settings.)
For seeing all messages use ;;;;;; for a correlation key structure looking as: ERPId;company[49];supplier1;OrderItenfifier;CreatedDate;
To listen for a specific company, use a filter like: ERPID;company[49];;;;

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Message tags. For a purchase order, these can be: REQUEST or CANCEL

parameters.name: correlationKeyFilter
parameters.description: The correlation key filter as explained in the summary

put.description:
This method updates statuses of all purchase order messages that meet the filter parameters.
This method behaves in the same way as the GET method that returns purchase order messages. Read the documentation of that method for details.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Message tags. For a purchase order, these can be: REQUEST or CANCEL

parameters.name: correlationKeyFilter
parameters.description: The Correlation key filter as explained in the summary

requestBody.description: Status that you want to set

post.description:
This method accepts an error message object, including a list of error messages.
The error message object includes a CorrelationKey that needs to match the corresponding purchase order message.

This method accepts a purchase order confirmation as a response to the purchase order message that was retrieved in the earlier step.
The purchase order confirmation object includes a CorrelationKey that needs to match the corresponding purchase order message.

This method accepts a purchase order cancellation as a response to the purchase order message that was retrieved in the earlier step.
The purchase order cancellation object includes a CorrelationKey that needs to match the corresponding purchase order message.

get.description:
The GET method returns the goods receipt note content from a message that matches the provided status and id.
If the message id is in another status, nothing is returned.

parameters.name: messageStatus
parameters.description: Message status. Can be: Posted, Fetched, Processing, Sent, Closed or Error

The GET method with message id as input returns a status and an effective link to goods receipt note content.
This method allows you to check the status of a given message.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Message id

get.description:
This method returns all goods receipt note messages that match the specified parameters.
The mandatory parameter is the status. The other parameter is sent as querystring parameter to narrow down the result.
The correlation key filter is used to filter out messages by the it's value.
The correlation key filter is built on a set of properties on the purchase order document with a delimiter: ';'.
(Be sure to check the number of ';' you have in your correlation key settings.)
For seeing all messages use ;;;;;; for a correlation key structure looking as: ERPId;company[49];supplier1;OrderItenfifier;CreatedDate;
To listen for a specific company, use a filter like: ERPID;company[49];;;;

parameters.name: correlationKeyFilter
parameters.description: The correlation key filter as explained in the summary

put.description:
This method updates statuses of all goods receipt note messages that meet the filter parameters.
This method behaves in the same way as the GET method that returns purchase order messages. Read the documentation of that method for details.

parameters.description: The Correlation key filter as explained in the summary

post.description:
This method accepts a purchase-order-to-ERP confirmation with or without the goods-receipt-note part
as a response to either the purchase-order-to-ERP or the goods-receipt-note confirmation or cancellation message, that was retrieved in the earlier step.
The confirmation object includes a CorrelationKey that needs to match the corresponding purchase-order-to-ERP or goods-receipt-note message.

The POST method allows the client to send basic restrictions for a dimension value that will be imported by the Medius master data import queue.
The dimensions involved in the restriction are mandatory.
Controlling dimension key is the dimension that will get the restriction applied on it, the property RestrictedDimension includes a list
with dimensions to restrict. For each restriction there is a set of RestrictionTypes, these are: Fixed, Forbidden, Default and Required

requestBody.description: The restrictions to import

201.description: Response includes Location header with a link to the import batch, this link will give the status of how the batch is processing within Medius

get.description:
The GET method will allow you to check status for an imported batch. When performing a POST, the link returned is pointing to this method.
This method allows the client to orchestrate so that the client can wait until dependent master data is imported correctly before sending that data.

parameters.name: importId
parameters.description: The import id is either retrieved by the full link from the result of the POST or from within the Medius master data import queue

delete.description:
The DELETE method allows a client to remove an import item from the queue, this to allow an integration to take full responsibility
of resending master data batches and handle all error on the client side instead of within Medius. it's only possible to remove items that are not in a running state.

parameters.name: importId
parameters.description: The import id is either retrieved by the full link from the result of the POST or from within the Medius master data import queue

post.description:
The POST method allows the client to send restriction rules that will be imported by data import queue.
The Restriction rules have company prerequisite.

201.description: Response includes Location header with a link to the import batch, this link will give the status of how the batch is processing within Medius

get.description:
The GET method will allow you to check status for an imported batch. When performing a POST, the link returned is pointing to this method.
This method allows the client to orchestrate so that the client can wait until dependent master data is imported correctly before sending that data.

parameters.name: importId
parameters.description: The import id is either retrieved by the full link from the result of the POST or from within the Medius master data import queue

post.description:
The POST method allows the client to send a set of supplier configurations that will be imported by the Medius master data import queue.
The supplier configuration needs to have the corresponding supplier in place before being imported.
Remember that by sending in supplier configurations the integration will updated them all the time, so manual changes of the properties included
in this data is not possible to set within Medius.

requestBody.description: The supplier configurations to import

201.description: Response includes Location header with a link to the import batch, this link will give the status of how the batch is processing within Medius

get.description:

parameters.name: importId
parameters.description: The import id is either retrieved by the full link from the result of the POST or from within the Medius master data import queue

get.description:
When calling this endpoint a list of suppliers will be returned.
There exists one filter parameter to this request, that is updatedSince, it filters out suppliers that have been changed since
the updatedSince time stamp.
It's possible adjust page sizes and offsets.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records returned(max 1000).

parameters.name: updatedSince
parameters.description: Tells the service that we only want suppliers that have been changed after this date and time.

parameters.name: identifierType
parameters.description: Filter suppliers by identifier type, eg. BANK_ACCOUNT. Requires identifier value.

parameters.name: identifierValue
parameters.description: Filter suppliers by identifier value, e.g. bank account number.

post.description:
The POST method allows the client to send suppliers that will be imported by the Medius master data import queue.
The supplier have payment term and company as mandatory prerequisite.
If additional dimensions are going to be used or Vat groups they need to be imported in advance.

requestBody.description: The suppliers to import

201.description: Response includes Location header with a link to the import batch, this link will give the status of how the batch is processing within Medius

get.description:
The GET method returns the supplier invoice content from a message that matches the status and the id.
If the message id is in another status, nothing will be returned. To find a message, use the other GET method that only provides message id as input.

parameters.name: messageStatus
parameters.description: The message status, can be Posted, Fetched, Processing, Sent, Closed or Error

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The id of the message

put.description: This method updates the status for a supplier invoice message when processing it.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The message id to change status for

parameters.name: messageStatus
parameters.description: The status that the message is in before the status change

requestBody.description: The status to set. Possible statuses are: Fetched, Processing or Sent

get.description:
The GET method with message id as input will return a status and an effective link to the real supplier invoice content.
The main idea with this method is to be able to check status for a give message and to be able to find where a message is in terms of statuses.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The message id of the message to find/check status

get.description:
This method returns all messages that matches the parameters sent in.
The mandatory parameter is the status parameter, besides that the other parameters are sent in as querystring parameters to narrow down the result.
The query string parameters are used to for instance limit on message type e.g. Preliminary or Posted.
The correlation key filter is used to filter out messages by the correlation key, typically used to filter on invoice type or by company.
The correlation key filter is built on a set of properties on the invoice with a delimiter: ';'.
(Please check the number of ';' you have in your correlation key settings.)
Seeing all messages would be ;;;;;; for a correlation key looking as: company[49];company[49];supplier1;company[49];supplier1;Invoice1;
Listing for a given company would give the following filter: company[49];;;;;;

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: The message tags, these can be the following for an invoice PRELIMINARY, FINAL, CANCEL or RELEASE_PAYMENT

parameters.name: correlationKeyFilter
parameters.description: The Correlation key filter as explained in the summary

put.description:
This method updates the status for all supplier invoice messages that meet the filter parameters.
This method behaves the same as the GET method that returns supplier invoice messages, please read there for details.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: The message tags, these can be the following for an invoice PRELIMINARY, FINAL, CANCEL or RELEASE_PAYMENT

parameters.name: correlationKeyFilter
parameters.description: The Correlation key filter as explained in the summary

requestBody.description: The status that you want to change

of resending master data batches and handle all error on the client side instead of within Medius. it's only possible to remove items that are not in a running state.

parameters.name: importId
parameters.description: The import id is either retrieved by the full link from the result of the POST or from within the Medius master data import queue

post.description:
The POST method allows the client to send tax groups that will be imported by the Medius master data import queue.
The tax group have company as mandatory prerequisite.
The tax group consists of a set of tax codes, in many "less advance" systems the translation is that tax code is the same as the tax group entity in Medius.
This means that if a tax code from the ERP i X, then tax group will be X and there will be one tax code line with X within the tax group.
When performing accounting on an invoice, the tax group is the one used. When providing a TaxIndicator on Supplier or dimensions, the Tax Group is the one to reference.
There is a property IndicatorNumber, this one decides if the TaxGroup is going to work with TaxIndicator 1 or 2.

requestBody.description: The tax groups to import

201.description: Response includes Location header with a link to the import batch, this link will give the status of how the batch is processing within Medius

post.description:
The POST method allows the client to send units that will be imported by the Medius master data import queue.
The units have no prerequisite.
Remember that the functionality around units is limited in Medius and the reason for importing them should probably be considered
before doing it. The usual case is to set the Unit on purchase order line to the default unit in Medius => '-'

requestBody.description: The units to import

201.description: Response includes Location header with a link to the import batch, this link will give the status of how the batch is processing within Medius

get.summary: Supplier invoice import status from APA
get.description:
The GET Method returns the status for a given DocumentImport document in Medius.
It also returns the "real" invoice that was created by the imported document.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the supplier invoice sent in. A full link to this method is returned by the POST method

post.description:
The POST method imports a supplier invoice, this is done with multipart/form content.
The location header in the response includes a full link to the GET method, this link can be stored as a ticket/receipt that Medius received the imported document.
NOTE: Due to that it needs to be sent in as multipart/form, the self testing experience in Swagger UI is limited.
To get the full test experience, please test this method in the Postman tool, all examples can be found here: https://www.getpostman.com/collections/36b522ecbddf6a8934d4

requestBody.description: DISCLAIMER: This is a multipart/form data type. Due to Swagger 2.0 it is impossible to visualize. Here you can see the definitions for the form data, and you can try it out. Image and attachments can not be included. For a complete specification see Postman or https://success.mediusflow.com/documentation/integration-documentation/technical/rest/scenarios/#running-the-supplier-invoice-import.

201.description: Response includes Location header with a link to the import batch, this link will give the status of how the document is processing within Medius.

post.summary: Supplier invoice file import to Capture
post.description:
The POST method uploads a PDF or XML invoice file from body to Capture.
It returns id of uploaded file. Note: the self testing experience in Swagger UI is limited. It is only possible to paste the XML body. Please use Postman or other test tools to send in PDF and XML files as binary.

parameters.name: companyGlobalId
parameters.description: Unique company identifier

parameters.name: supplierGlobalId
parameters.description: Unique supplier identifier

parameters.name: externalId
parameters.description: Unique external identifier to corresponding entity

requestBody.description: A PEPPOL BIS Billing 3.0 XML or PDF file containing invoice for Capture. Maximum file size is 50 MB.

201.description: Response includes the id of uploaded file

invoiceType.description: Type of invoice. If empty, Medius tries to set.

eInvoiceTrackingId.description: A tracking id for e-invoices for reporting and control.

documentFormat.description: Format of the invoice. To administrate and list possible values, see 'Administration/Document source management' in APA.

documentProvider.description: Provider of the invoice. To administrate and list possible values, see 'Administration/Document source management' in APA.

documentSource.description: Obsolete. When 'DocumentFormat' and 'DocumentProvider' is used, 'DocumentSource' is set automatically.

captureUser.description: User responsible for capturing document from external source.

invoiceDate.description: Invoice date of the invoice. If empty, today's date will be used.

dueDate.description: Due date of the invoice. If empty, due date will be calculated based on suppliers payment terms.

preferredPaymentDate.description: Preferred payment date of the invoice. If empty, preferred payment date will follow invoice due date.

currencyRate.description: Currency rate can be imported if other currency rate needed than calculated based on invoice date. Currency rate expressed as ratio of company's accounting currency value to document's currency value. Decimal format (28,14).

taxIndicator1.description: External system id to corresponding TaxIndicator1.

taxIndicator2.description: External system id to corresponding TaxIndicator2.

reference.description: Reference is validated against user name and First + Last name, if found invoice is distributed.

paymentReference.description: Payment reference. Can be used as reference at payment.

items.description: Creates a link to a referenced document. Note that the system only creates the links to the referenced documents if it finds valid references. This is particularly useful for credit notes where document references to registered invoices can be used for the linkage.

contractNumber.description: Contract number. Note: if this fields is populated Medius will consider this document as contract based regardless of the field InvoiceType.

deliveryNote.description: Delivery note. Note: if this fields is populated Medius will consider this document as order based regardless of the field InvoiceType.

orderIdentifier.description: Order identifier, used for connection against purchase order. Note: if this fields is populated Medius will consider this document as order based regardless of the field InvoiceType.

orderIdentifier2.description: Order identifier 2, used as free text information. Note: if this fields is populated Medius will consider this document as order based regardless of the field InvoiceType.

splitTaxLines.description: For information on how to set-up Split tax, see Success documentation.

isStraightToArchive.description: Parameter to send invoice straight to archive without approval and ERP integration.

paymentDetails.description: Identifier for payment details. Note: this field would be used to populate the PaymentDetails on invoice only when PaymentDetails is turned on for given company.

vatDate.description: VAT date for an invoice, for example, the date when goods have been received or a service has started.

quantity.description: Quantity of the invoice line. If not provided, quantity will be 0. Decimal format (28,14).

unitPrice.description: Unit price of the invoice line. If not provided, unit price will be calculated by Amount/Quantity. Decimal format (28,14).

unit.description: Unit of measure. If not provided, '-' will be set as default.

orderIdentifier2.description: Order identifier 2 of the invoice line, used as free text information.

taxPercentage.description: Tax percentage. See Success documentation for further information on Split tax. Decimal format (19,5).

netAmount.description: Net amount of the tax line. See Success documentation for further information on Split tax. Decimal format (28,14).

name.description: Name of custom tax. Note: Need to be set-up and correspond to information in given company.

payorId.description: Same as one of the company identifiers from Medius AP Automation. In order to import payment batch, matching identifier must be found

externalBatchId.description: External Payment Batch identifier. If provided then it has to be unique across all successfully imported batches.

items.description: Adding items to the import batch is mandatory. The limit is 5000 items per batch.  **NOTE:** follow either PaymentItemUS or PaymentItemEU depending on your company location.

invoiceNumber.description: Payee-assigned invoice number. Must not appear twice for the same payee within a payments batch file. Will also be presented on Remittance advice for the vendor.

invoiceVoucherNumber.description: Invoice voucher number from ERP, used to match the payment against an invoice posted in AP Automation

invoiceCompanyId.description: Company the invoice has been posted to in AP automation. Same as Company Id in Medius AP Automation. In order to import payment batch, matching identifier must be found.

payeeId.description: Payee identifier - should be same as SupplierId in Medius AP Automation. Should be unique to each payee. Restricted characters: /  ? #

remitToID.description: Identifier for a different remittance number or name for a payee (payees with multiple locations).

payeeName.description: Payee name - should be same as supplier name in Medius AP Automation. Up to 255 characters allowed for domestic payments.

payeeStreetLine1.description: Street address of the payee. Up to 60 characters allowed for domestic payments.

payeeStreetLine2.description: Second line of street address of the payee. Up to 60 characters allowed for domestic payments.

payeeCity.description: City of the payee. Up to 50 characters allowed for domestic payments

payeeZipOrPostalCode.description: Zip code or Postal code of the Payee. Max length of 10 character with minimum of 5 character length. Examples: US = 32202-4934 or 32202, Canada = A1A 1A1

payeeStateCode.description: State code of the payee. The country subdivision code, ISO 3166-2. Optional for international payments. Required for US and Canadian payments.

payeeCountryCode.description: Country code of the payee. ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code.

paymentAmount.description: The amount to be paid for the invoice, may vary from invoice amount in case of partial payments or short payments. Max 12 digital places, including up to 2 decimal places

paymentCurrencyCode.description: Currency in which vendor will be paid. ISO Alfa 3 code.

invoiceDueDate.description: Invoice Due Date in format yyyy-MM-dd. Note: If not provided, no due date will be displayed on the remittance advice.

preferredPaymentDate.description: The date on which payment should be executed. If left empty, current date will be used.

invoiceAmount.description: Original invoice amount, may vary from paymentAmount in case of partial payments or short payment. Max 12 digital places including up to 2 decimal places

invoiceCurrencyCode.description: Currency of invoice. Required if invoiceAmount send. ISO Alfa 3 code.

payorBankAccountIdentifier.description: Bank account identifier from customer accounting system. Needs to be an unique identifier for all payment items in the batch.

payorLocationIdentifier.description: [Deprecated field. The field will be ignored by new customers and removed by the end of December 2024.] Legal entity, department, branch office, etc.

comment.description: Comment for invoice from payor accounting system. Will be displayed on the check and remittance advice.

payorIdInPayeeSystem.description: Payor assigned account number with payee. Will be displayed on remittance advice.

payeeBankName.description: Name of the beneficiary bank. Required for international payments.

payeeBankStreetLine1.description: Payees banks address line 1. Required for international payments.

payeeBankStreetLine2.description: Payees banks address line 2. Required for international payments.

payeeBankCity.description: Payees banks city. Required for international payments.

payeeBankCountryCode.description: Payees banks country. ISO Alpha2 code. Required for international payments.

payeeAccountNumber.description: IBAN or basic account number. No spaces or dashes permitted. Required for international payments.

payeeRoutingNumber.description: Required field when basic account number provided in payeeAccountNumber field. Optional if IBAN provided. This could be known as RoutingNumber, BranchCode, ABA number, transit number, MICR, IFSC, etc.

payeeRoutingNumberType.description: Required field when payee routing number provided in payeeRoutingNumber field. Allowed values: ACH, Wire

payeeBankSwiftCode.description: Required field when IBAN provided in payeeAccountNumber field. A unique identification code assigned to a specific bank to proceed money transfer between banks internationally. Needs to match regex included as pattern.

purposeOfPayment.description: Purpose of payment. Required for international payment to some countries.

payeeContactEmail.description: Used to send confirmation email to payee. Required for international payments

paymentReference.description: A payment reference number or check number from the customers accounting system. Will be displayed on remittance advice. Note: If not specified, will be generated during payment process. If generated during payment process, there will be one payment reference for all invoices to be paid to a single payee.

discountAmount.description: Amount of discount subtracted from "Invoice amount" to arrive at "Amount to pay". This field is not used for calculation. It is informational only.

discountCurrencyCode.description: Currency for discount provided in "Discount Amount". This field is not used for calculation. It is informational only. ISO Alfa 3 code.

invoiceNumber.description: Payee-assigned invoice number. Must not appear twice for the same payee within a payments batch file.

invoiceVoucherNumber.description: Invoice voucher number from ERP, used to match the payment against an invoice posted in AP Automation

invoiceCompanyId.description: Company the invoice has been posted to in AP automation. Same as Company Id in Medius AP Automation. In order to import payment batch, matching identifier must be found

payeeId.description: Payee identifier - should be same as SupplierId in Medius AP Automation. Should be unique to each payee. Restricted characters: /  ? # |

remitToID.description: Identifier for a different remittance number or name for a payee (payees with multiple locations or bank accounts). Restricted characters: /  ? # |

payeeName.description: Payee name - should be same as supplier name in Medius AP Automation. Up to 255 characters allowed for domestic payments

payeeStreetLine1.description: Street address of the payee. __Note:__ required for international payments.

payeeStreetLine2.description: Second line of street address of the payee.

payeeCity.description: City of the payee. __Note:__ required for international payments.

payeeZipOrPostalCode.description: Zip or Postal Code of the payee. __Note:__ required for international payments.

payeeStateCode.description: State code of the payee. The country subdivision code, ISO 3166-2. __Note:__ required for international payments.

payeeCountryCode.description: Country code of the payee. ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code.

paymentAmount.description: The amount to be paid for the invoice, may vary from invoice amount in case of partial payments or short payments. Max 12 digital places, including up to 2 decimal places. Maximum amount per item __2.000.000__, minimum amount per item __0.1__

paymentCurrencyCode.description: Currency in which vendor will be paid. ISO Alfa 3 code. When payeeBankgiroNumber is provided, paymentCurrencyCode needs to be in 'SEK'.

invoiceDueDate.description: Invoice Due Date in format yyyy-MM-dd.

preferredPaymentDate.description: The date on which payment should be executed. If left empty, current date will be used.

invoiceAmount.description: Original invoice amount, may vary from paymentAmount in case of partial payments or short payment. Max 12 digital places including up to 2 decimal places

invoiceCurrencyCode.description: Currency of invoice. Required if invoiceAmount send. ISO Alfa 3 code.

comment.description: Comment for invoice from payor accounting system for information purposes during batch authorization process.

payorBankAccountIdentifier.description: Internal bank identifier, defined during funding bank account setup in Medius Pay. Needs to be an unique identifier for all payment items in the batch.

payeeBankCountryCode.description: Payees banks country. ISO Alpha2 code.

payeeAccountNumber.description: IBAN or basic account number. No spaces or dashes permitted. If IBAN is provided, payeeBankSwiftCode is required. If basic account number is provided, payeeBankSwiftCode or payeeRoutingNumber is required. PayeeAccountNumber is optional if payeeBankgiroNumber is provided.

payeeBankgiroNumber.description: When payeeBankgiroNumber is provided, payeeAccountNumber, payeeRoutingNumber and payeeBankSwiftCode are optional. If both payeeBankgiroNumber and combination of payeeAccountNumber, payeeRoutingNumber and payeeBankSwiftCode are provided, the combination of (payeeAccountNumber and payeeBankSwiftCode) or (payeeAccountNumber and payeeRoutingNumber) are used for payment execution.

payeeRoutingNumber.description: Required field when basic account number provided in payeeAccountNumber field. Optional if IBAN provided. This could be known as RoutingNumber, BranchCode, ABA number, transit number, MICR, IFSC, etc. Required for international payments in some countries.

payeeBankSwiftCode.description: A unique identification code assigned to a specific bank to proceed money transfer between banks internationally. Needs to match regex included as pattern.

payeeContactEmail.description: Used to send confirmation email to payee.

paymentReference.description: A payment reference number from the customers accounting system. If not provided, invoiceNumber will be used as payment reference.

isSuccessful.description: true when payment batch was successfully imported otherwise false.

importDateTime.description: Date and time of payment batch import

payorBankAccountIdentifier.description: Internal bank identifier, defined during funding bank account setup in Medius Pay

payeeName.description: Payee name - the same as supplier name in Medius AP Automation. Up to 255 characters allowed for domestic payments

payeeId.description: Payee identifier - the same as SupplierId in Medius AP Automation. Should be unique to each payee. Restricted characters: /  ? # |

invoiceNumber.description: Payee-assigned invoice number. Must not appear twice for the same payee within a payments batch file

invoiceAmount.description: Original invoice amount, may vary from paymentAmount in case of partial payments or short payment. Max 12 digital places including up to 2 decimal places

amountToPay.description: The amount paid for the invoice, may vary from invoice amount in case of partial payments or short payments

paymentCurrency.description: Currency in which the invoice was paid. ISO Alfa 3 code.

paidAmountInSettlementCurrency.description: The amount paid in settlement currency

feeCurrency.description: Currency in which fee was paid. ISO Alfa 3 code
